sentences: John Everett Sandlin Jr. (April 16, 1945 â€“ September 19, 2017) was an American recording engineer and record producer.
Sandlin was born in Decatur, Alabama, and attended Athens State University.

Sandlin began his music career as a guitar player in The Impacts, a band he co-founded while attending Decatur High and went on to become the drummer of The Five Minutes, was a member of Hour Glass alongside Duane and Gregg Allman, and recorded as a session musician in Miami, playing drums, bass, and guitar.
Sandlin died of cancer in Decatur, Alabama, at the age of 72.
